channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The 3 steps smart CEOs are taking in a volatile tariff environment, according to the head of a major global leadership advisory firm
item.description: Economic and geopolitical uncertainty are top of mind for C-suite leaders, according to the latest report on leadership advisory firm Russell Reynolds...

item.title: Trump Ends Chinese Tariff Loophole, Raising the Cost of Online Goods
item.description: Supporters say the change is important to stop cheap Chinese goods from entering the U.S. But the decision could drive up prices for goods Americans b...

item.title: Jill Sobule, Singer of ‘I Kissed a Girl,’ Dies in House Fire
item.description: Ms. Sobule, 66, died Thursday morning in Woodbury, Minn., her publicist said. She had been scheduled to perform songs from her musical later in the we...

item.title: For Delta and Accenture CEOs, helping employees navigate trade and tariffs uncertainty fits the company culture
item.description: Accenture launched tariff education initiatives, and Delta stuck with planned pay hikes despite weaker business confidence.

item.title: Reform U.K. Wins Special Election in Runcorn by Just 6 Votes
item.description: Nigel Farage’s right-wing populist party snatched a critical parliamentary seat from the governing Labour Party.

item.title: Employers hired steadily in April, unfazed by tariff announcements
item.description: U.S. employers added 177,000 jobs last month.

item.title: For the U.S. and China, the Only Talking Is About Whether to Talk
item.description: The standoff over terms of negotiations, and whether they are happening, signals that a protracted economic fight lies ahead.

item.title: Japan’s historic work ethic is declining—45% of workers admit they’re quiet quitting
item.description: Workers said they do the basics required for their jobs for various reasons, but cite wanting a better work-life balance.

item.title: How Rubio Proved Himself as Trump’s Loyal Foreign Policy Foot Soldier
item.description: As Secretary of State, Marco Rubio has been Donald Trump’s reliable echo on issues like Iran, Ukraine and Gaza. But Steve Witkoff, the president’s fri...

item.title: PPG CEO says company is ready to navigate Trump tariff uncertainty: ‘Our top 30 suppliers for our U.S. businesses, 0 of them are Chinese’
item.description: PPG reported net sales of $3.68 billion for the quarter, a 4% decline from the year prior, impacted by foreign exchange rates and recent divestitures.

item.title: Maps: 7.4-Magnitude Earthquake Near Chile Prompts Tsunami Alert
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Reform U.K. Wins Special Election in Runcorn by Just 6 Votes
item.description: Nigel Farage’s right-wing populist party snatched a critical parliamentary seat from the governing Labour Party.

item.title: Six Deadly Minutes: How Israeli Soldiers Killed 15 Rescue Workers in Gaza
item.description: Israel’s military said it was reacting to an immediate threat when it killed 15 medics and first responders in Gaza in March. But eyewitness accounts ...

item.title: How Rubio Proved Himself as Trump’s Loyal Foreign Policy Foot Soldier
item.description: As Secretary of State, Marco Rubio has been Donald Trump’s reliable echo on issues like Iran, Ukraine and Gaza. But Steve Witkoff, the president’s fri...

item.title: Exxon and Chevron Report Lower Profits While Girding for Tariffs
item.description: President Trump’s trade policies have helped to push down oil prices while raising the costs of materials for oil and gas companies.
